text: Donald Adam May (February 22, 1927 – January 28, 2022) was an American actor. His TV roles include Sam Colt Jr. in the Western series Colt .45 (1957–1960) and Adam Drake in the soap opera The Edge of Night (1967–1977). His movie credits include The Crowded Sky (1960), Kisses for My President (1964) and Follow Me, Boys! (1966). May's other TV acting credits include The West Point Story, Sugarfoot, Cheyenne, 77 Sunset Strip, Hawaiian Eye, Surfside 6, The Roaring 20's, Men into Space, Barnaby Jones, The Dukes of Hazzard, Dallas, Texas, Falcon Crest, Fantasy Island, One Life to Live, All My Children and L.A. Law. May was born in Chicago, Illinois. He had two children with his first wife. He later married actress Carla Borelli. May died on January 28, 2022 in Upstate New York, at the age of 94. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1927 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Actors from Chicago Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors
